Package org.myshelfie.view.GUI

Class ViewGUI

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
org.myshelfie.view.GUI.ViewGUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, View
public class ViewGUI extends javafx.application.Application implements View
This class is the graphical interface of the client.

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewGUI

      public ViewGUI()
      Constructor for the ViewGUI class. It creates a new Client object and connects to the server. Then it initializes a map containing the names of the scenes and their paths. This will be used to set the scene of the stage, exploiting the UserInputListener responses to transition between scenes, calling the setScene method with appropriate parameters.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Start the JavaFX application.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:

    • setScene

      public void setScene(String sceneName)
      Set the scene of the stage to the one specified by the sceneName parameter.
      Parameters:
      sceneName - The name of the scene to set

    • update

      public void update(GameView msg, GameEvent ev)
      Main method of the View interface, which allows to show the updated model using information contained in the GameView object. This is actually used only when the game is started, that's why it calls the GameControllerFX.update(org.myshelfie.network.messages.gameMessages.GameEvent, org.myshelfie.network.messages.gameMessages.GameView) method.
      Specified by:
      update in interface View
      Parameters:
      msg - The GameView that represents the immutable version of the updated model
      ev - Event that caused the model's change

    • waitForRunLater

      protected static void waitForRunLater() throws InterruptedException
      Util method to wait for the JavaFX thread to execute a Runnable. Call this method after executing a command that is queued in the JavaFX thread with a Platform.runLater call. You can find an example in the update method, where the GameControllerFX.update(org.myshelfie.network.messages.gameMessages.GameEvent, org.myshelfie.network.messages.gameMessages.GameView) has to be called after the Game scene is set.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • run

      public void run()
      Run method called at the end of the start method. Sets the scene to the Login one, which is actually the first one.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Specified by:
      run in interface View

    • endLoginPhase

      public void endLoginPhase()
      Method called by the UserInputListener when the login phase is ended, triggering the transition to the Lobbies scene or to the Game scene if the client is reconnecting.
      Specified by:
      endLoginPhase in interface View

    • endLobbyPhase

    • setAvailableGames

      public void setAvailableGames(List<GameController.GameDefinition> availableGamesList)
      Setter for the list of available games. Once retrieved, this information is forwarded to the LobbiesControllerFX object, which is the controller responsible for the Lobby scene.
      Specified by:
      setAvailableGames in interface View
      Parameters:
      availableGamesList - The list of available games

    • nicknameAlreadyUsed

      public void nicknameAlreadyUsed()
      Method called when the server signals that the nickname chosen by the player is already used by another player. Forwards the call to the LoginControllerFX object, which is the controller responsible for the Login scene. Called by the UserInputListener.
      Specified by:
      nicknameAlreadyUsed in interface View

    • setReconnecting

      public void setReconnecting(boolean reconnecting)
      Set the reconnecting status for the player using this GUI.
      Specified by:
      setReconnecting in interface View
      Parameters:
      reconnecting - True if the player is reconnecting, false otherwise
